snippet: Paul D. Ryan, the Republican vice presidential candidate, uses an appearance to attack President Obama, while Mitt Romney and his wife chat it up with TV hosts.
abstract: Mitt Romney and his running mate Rep Paul D Ryan offer varied messages on the campaign trail, with Ryan criticizing Pres Obama in unusually caustic terms while Romney allows lighthearted humanizing glimpses of himself in interviews.

byline.original: By ASHLEY PARKER and TRIP GABRIEL
byline.contributor: Ashley Parker reported from Painesville, and Trip Gabriel from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Paul D. Ryan, the Republican vice presidential candidate, uses an appearance to attack President Obama, while Mitt Romney and his wife chat it up with TV hosts.

headline.seo: For Romney and Ryan, It’s Hardball and Softball
headline.main: While Ryan Throws Hardballs, Romney Makes Friends on Morning TV
headline.print_headline: While Ryan Throws Hardballs, Romney Makes Friends on Morning TV
